pullRequest.title: [Feature] Manual inline feedback for Programming Exercises and fix repo is locked label
pullRequest.bodyText:
Checklist

 I tested all changes and all related features with different users (student, tutor, instructor, admin) on the test server https://artemistest.ase.in.tum.de.
 Client: I added multiple integration tests (Jest) related to the features (with a high test coverage)
 Client: I documented the TypeScript code using JSDoc style.
 Client: I added multiple screenshots/screencasts of my UI changes
 Client: I translated all the newly inserted strings into German and English

Motivation and Context


At the moment tutors or instructors are not able to give feedback for a specific line of code for programming exercises.
Description


Use CodeEditorAceComponent for the inline feedbacks (referenced feedback)
Created InlineFeedbackComponent which is displayed in the AceEditor
Allow tutors to add unreferenced and general feedback
Add label which indicates how many points the assessment has
UI fix for 'repository is locked' label in CodeEditorStudentComponent

Steps for Testing


Log in to Artemis
Navigate to Course Administration
Create a programming exercise and participate with several different users
Login as tutor/instructor and assess the programming exercise
When hovering over the gutter (line numbers on the left) an plus icon appears and click
Add inline feedback
Add unreferenced feedback
Add general feedback
Check if the points label adapts accordingly
Submit your assessment and see if everything is updated accordingly and works as expected (check also student view)
Check also for complaints and exam

Test Coverage


code-editor-tutor-assessment-inline-feedback.component.ts: 95%
code-editor-tutor-assessment-container.component.ts: 69.49%
code-editor-ace.component.ts: 66.06%

Screenshots


As a Tutor:
Hover over code and click on plus button..

.. inline comment appears and you can enter feedback text and points. Color changes depending on the given points..

..after clicking on save.

Unrefenreced and general feedback as known from the other exercises:

Student view:

Feedback info:

nodes.bodyText: I think the animation for the icon getting larger could be a bit faster so I would suggest 200ms here, but this is really just personal preference 😄

Do we really need that here? If there is no special reason I would omit that so that instead of getting this:

we could have that div simply adjust its width to the parent like this:
do we really need this? We have FeedbackType.MANUAL for this
For the future, it would be nice, if tutors can also select certain characters of a line. I think this could be extended using file:${this.fileName}_line:${this.codeLine}_characters:{start}:{end}
